attributes.action: All Covid daily updates not from tabloids, opposition leaders that are shut down
attributes.additional_details: I feel it is completely unacceptable that the mainstream media are able to scrutinise the government but the shut down government are not. Disgraceful.
attributes.background: I feel that it is completely unacceptable that during the early evening parliament updates all questions to the government are from the main stream media, they do not represent me. All the questions each night must be from each parliamentary leader representing government parties currently shut down

rejection.details:
We understand that you're not happy with the how the Government's daily press briefings work, but it's not clear what you want the Government to do to change this.

The daily press briefings are arranged to enable the Government to brief and answer questions from the press. Since you started your petition the House of Commons has returned from recess, so MPs representing opposition parties are able to question the Government in the House of Commons.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
